column4: does anyone know a way to use dd to append to an existing file?
you need to use the 'cd' command.
so if you are at a command prompt, you are probbly at somthing like "user@ubuntu:~" right?
thats what i tried...cuz im familiar with MS-DOS
the commands work a little diffrent
the first thing you need to know is that the commands a Case Sensitive.
Desktop is not the same as desktop, DeSkToP, etc...
also, 'cd' all by itself will return you to your home directory, where you are now
yeah. thats where i am stuck
i am stuck in my home directory and i dont know how to navigate with the command line to run any programs
your desktop is in '~/Desktop' where ~ means your home directory.
'cd' will always take you back to your home directory. so will 'cd ~'
